duck: Syntax highlighting, display of text in different colors and/or fonts, depending upon its meaning in context (e.g. different parts of speech in a sentence, or function vs. variables names in computer source code)
Specular highlight, a spot of light that appears on shiny objects when illuminated by a direct light source
highlight definition: the lightest spot or area (as in a painting).
Hair highlighting, lightening and/or coloring part of someone's hair
Highlights (album), album by Tom Hingley and the Lovers
Highlights for Children a.k.a. Highlights: Fun with a Purpose, a US-published children's magazine

wiki.text:
'Highlight' (and 'highlights', 'highlighting', etc.) may refer to:

* In art (including photography, painting, drawing, and digital compositions),
  any of the brightest parts of a subject, in contrast to shadow
* An especially significant or interesting detail or occurrence of
  something larger (e.g. highlights of a football game or the highlight of
  a dramatic role)
* In computing, to select on-screen information as for a cut, copy and paste
  *Specular highlight, a spot of light that appears on shiny objects when
  illuminated by a direct light source

*Hair highlighting, lightening and/or coloring part of someone's hair *Syntax
highlighting, display of text in different colors and/or fonts, depending upon
its meaning in context (e.g. different parts of speech in a sentence, or
function vs. variables names in computer source code)

*To use a highlighter, a marker pen that adds translucent color to paper, to
emphasize particular parts of the text

* Highlights (band), a Swedish dansband
* ''Highlights'' (album), album by Tom Hingley and the Lovers
* [[Highlights for Children]] a.k.a. Highlights: Fun with a Purpose, a US-
  published children's magazine
* Highlights, a public page on the Russian social networking site VKontakte
* Highlight (application), a social networking application
wiki.title: highlight
